website_summaries.verdict: The type of gaming monitor from BenQ to buy when you want a curved monitor experience.
pros: Subtle screen curve creates a more immersive gaming experience than flat displays
Comes in a 35" option for an even more expansive experience
cons: Monitor has been known to arrive with dead pixels, failing to work correctly

customer_reviews.title: Quality control issues.
customer_reviews.text: First monitor arrived with 2 dead pixels and a strange banding on several spots across the screen. Very nice picture though with awesome contrast for a VA panel. Placed a return and received a 2nd monitor, but again had another pixel sized defect in the matte finish. Quality control seems to be a bit of an issue. Will keep this monitor though for the defect is in the very bottom center of the screen.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D.

customer_reviews.title: Good screen, Sound BROKEN!
customer_reviews.text: Like the look of the monitor. but when i plugged in my nintendo switch with the hdmi cord, no sound comes out. I turned the volume all the way up on the tv, nothing! this $300+ screen has no sound. I would like someone to offer me a slight refund. this is a damaged product.
customer_reviews.author: TIpping Toast

customer_reviews.title: Amazing monitor. Though it was going to be hard ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing monitor. Though it was going to be hard to play fps shooters on such a big screen but it just made them funnier.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas hopper

customer_reviews.title: Great BIG monitor for the money
customer_reviews.text: Love the BenQ 31.5" curved monitor after two months, great picture and great gaming. No monitor speakers, so I bought a JBL Bluetooth speaker to handle sound, which makes for a wonderful combination (kind of like LCD TV and soundbar).
customer_reviews.author: Mike in Arizona

customer_reviews.title: LOVE it, the 31
customer_reviews.text: Thus far , LOVE it, the 31.5" is just what i wanted size wise, has a nice slight curve, Just what i wanted to enhance my video editing on a bigger screen
customer_reviews.author: Gary L

customer_reviews.title: for work or play, these things are 5-star....<3 BenQ
customer_reviews.text: I have the larger version for gaming, use this one for work, and love it! can throw multiple things on screen at once. lovely. No issues @ all.
customer_reviews.author: TEX

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor have had for months now and no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: This monitor is awesome original settings are really good and has a clear ...
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is awesome original settings are really good and has a clear display I had one little dead pixel but I'm not that worried about it other than that best monitor that I have had I originally had a 1ms 144hz but I can't tell the different with the 4 ms
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor resolution - not suitable for office work
customer_reviews.text: This might be fine for gaming and video. NOT suitable for office work. The resolution is too grainy for this size display. Need higher resolution if working on spreadsheets and documents. I would rate it lower but, again, it might be good for gaming and video.
customer_reviews.author: PrivacyPlease

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what the hype is on the curved screen, but it works
customer_reviews.text: We are always looking to upgrade our computer equipment and with all the hype of a curved screen, we were excited. This screen is nice and clear. The nearly 32" makes for a nice size for gaming, but a little big for working on (at least in my opinion). What I haven't really gotten yet though is the curved screen. I do not feel more immersed in the game, nor do I see anything more than I would on a flat screen. if anything, my peripheral vision is worse. I don't know, maybe I'm old school, but I prefer the flat screen. If this happened to be 3D, maybe it would be another story.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Imprssive Video Viewing Experience with excellent color saturation
customer_reviews.text: I like this monitor because it provides lots of room to open up multiple windows and still be able to see and read them clearly. While the resolution/sharpness is slightly poorer (compared side by side) to a 27 inch diagonal 4K monitor the overall viewing and usage experience is better on this monitor. Color saturation in particular is better than my 4K comparison monitor and the curved surface also seems to be a plus for viewing videos. Great job BenQ
customer_reviews.author: David Ross

customer_reviews.title: Good as a TV monitor...Needs more pixels for computer display
customer_reviews.text: TL;DR If you need a monitor to serve as a high quality computer monitor and to be used for gaming and video watching the get BenQ’s higher end monitors which pack more pixels. Large monitor, photos don’t do justice. IMO the curve actually enhances the viewing experience. The monitor comes with a hdmi cable as well as a DisplayPort cable, allowing use with MacBooks. The screen is a matte finish, not glossy. Good as a 1080P video monitor but the 1080P resolution and pixel density make this mainly for watching movie/tv show and/or gaming monitor. It lacks enough pixels to be used as a high quality computer monitor.
customer_reviews.author: P120D1GY

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is amazing. Everything looks betrer on it, including tv shows, movies and amazon! It also just looks high tech on my desk. Was easy to install too. Comes with easy to understand directions and I'm not electronically minded and had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: K. Cade

customer_reviews.title: Console gaming
customer_reviews.text: It is definitely not optimal for console gaming, just in case I'm the only one who doesn't know. It's beautiful out of the box though and I love it, but for my PS4 pro, it's not the best option.
customer_reviews.author: Deezy

product_meta.title: BenQ EX3200R 31.5" Curved Monitor 1080p 144Hz FreeSync Low Blue Light Flicker-Free HDMI
product_meta.description: Video enjoyment has never been better. Treat your eyes to an immersive time with BenQ EX3200R, a 31.5 inch curved entertainment monitor. Designed to have a curvature of 1800R to increase your field of view, matched with Cinema mode and video format support, movie enthusiasts can enjoy a more cinematic experience. Curved monitors are perfect for multimedia applications and multitasking.
feature_bullets: 31.5 inch curved gaming VA panel with FHD (1920 x 1080) resolution
144 Hz refresh rate and free-sync technology ensures a smooth and fluid gaming experience.
Low display lag (4 ms GTG) for quick response in game.
Complete your immersive experience, optimize gaming and cinema viewing with custom height/tilt and color display settings.
BenQ’s exclusive Zeroflicker and Low Blue Light features provide comfortable viewing for gaming and entertainment.
Multiple display inputs provide connectivity options (HDMI1.4, Display port 1.2, mini Display port 1.2, Headphone Jack)
Mounting type: VESA wall mounting 100x100 mm‎

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars23 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
